events.body: You cannot fix typos in subtrees, so please remove all changes to them. Feel free to send the changes upstream.

Concept 0 % s/contruct/construct

`Invokable` and `useable` or both acceptable alternatives to `invocable` and `usable`. Their usage is correct and you're just swapping out one correct version for another. Bitcoin contributions come from all over the world, no need to impose the 'American' version of words.
Agree with @jarolrod here. These seem to be okay (apart from "contruct"). Don't make changes just for the sake of making changes, please.

issue.title: p2p: Remove -feefilter option
issue.body:
net: Remove -feefilter option, as it is debug only and isn't used in any tests. Checking this option for every peer on every iteration of the message handler is unnecessary, as described in #21545.
refactor: Move feefilter logic out into a separate `MaybeSendFeefilter(...)` function to improve readability of the already long `SendMessages(...)`. fixes  #21545

The configuration option `-feefilter` has been added in 9e072a6e66efbda7d39bf61eded21d2b324323be: _"Implement "feefilter" P2P message"_
According to the [BIP133](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0133.mediawiki), turning the fee filter off was ment for:
> [...] a node [...] using prioritisetransaction to accept transactions whose actual fee rates might fall below the node's mempool min fee [in order to] disable the fee filter to make sure it is exposed to all possible txid's

`-feefilter` was subsequently set as debug only in #8150, with the motivation that the help message was too difficult to translate.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #21992 (Feefilter cleanups by amadeuszpawlik)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Thank you for your contribution. However, this patch seems controversial, so I am going to close for now.

comments.body:
https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/useable

Also, if you want to modify libraries, you will have to do it upstream
Not sure why you've dropped this and changed usages to `usable`, so you can revert that as well.
Most of the spelling in the codebase uses `usable` not `useable`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/libexec/prelude.bash"
 ###################

-# Required non-builtin commands should be invokable
+# Required non-builtin commands should be invocable
comments.body: is that really a typo? invokable seems to exist: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/invokable (and that site lists invocable as an alternative spelling)

comments.body: `invocable` is in the codebase twice and `invokable` once.  Should I change them all to `invokable` ?
